intro: Ornithogalum amboense, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems. The plant produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a basal rosette. Ornithogalum amboense is typically found in grasslands and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
